website_summaries.verdict: If you're in the market for a serious D-SLR, but don't want to go full-frame, the Nikon D7100 is the way to go; it's our Editors' Choice camera in its category.
pros: Preserves details at high ISO settings
Sensor design omits optical low-pass filter
cons: Limited burst shooting in Raw mode
Some image noise at ISO 3200 and above

customer_reviews.title: Forced upgrade due to theft, but well worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: Great update on the 7000, though a bit confusing at first with buttons being changed & light meter going in the opposite direction. Love the lock button on left dial, always moving accidentally on the 7000 not now with the 7100, small item but great improvement. 24mp from 15mp looks good, just need more computer power to handle. Otherwise only four hays to get it working the way I use it. The Manual is a great improvement from the last one, I can read it and the front section is a better index.
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: Small body but high quality images
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is excellent with large file sizes, indeed one can use two SD cards and captures JPEGs and RAW images at the same time if required. The controls are a little more fiddly compared to Pro bodies like the D2, D3 or D4 but this is partly due to the compact size of the body. This is its only major disadvantage to some extent. After using Pro bodies for years this feels very small indeed. Nonetheless it is a good compromise, given the lower cost, and certainly worth considering as a spare body.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W

customer_reviews.title: Hmm - It's a good camera but to be honest I didn't notice too ...
customer_reviews.text: Hmm - It's a good camera but to be honest I didn't notice too much of a difference between this and my D90. Yes higher res and a tad sharper, nice body with bells and whistles, but I decided to go FX and purchased the D750. Now I see the difference in many aspects , if you're swithering between another DX and FX , well the latter is always going to give you better quality and that's the real upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stunning Pictures
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Nikon SLRs. This version however, blows the rest out of the water. The quality of pictures are exceptional, the processor rapid and the automatic and scene settings remarkably good. Its a camera that allows amateurs (like me) to capture incredible pictures, and one i am sure that more proficient photographers could exploit to capture exceptional pictures. I love it, and i loved the price!
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great image quality
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, fast autofocus and works well in low light situations. Takes great images. Only negative is that the buffer fills up very quickly when shooting raw images.
customer_reviews.author: ickle

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious piece of equipment I am into photography and just been on a holiday so had an ideal opportunity to use it.The photographs are all just fantastic so clear also so many other features that you can use,would not hesitate to recommend this camera to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: maxibe54

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product value for money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product arrived even before the estimated due date which was fab great service great picture quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: D7100
customer_reviews.text: Previously owned the D3100 however wanted more control over my camera and also the extra dials and buttons. Professional feel to the camera and menus compared to the D3100 and amazing picture quality. Did purchase a grip (not the official nikon one) to add stability as I have big hands and the camera feels perfect. It's a big jump from the D3100 and my picture composition and quality have improved dramatically! Thoroughly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR, I owned film SLR's before this. It is a complex beastie and I will be still learning about it in a few years time. The instruction manual is over 200 pages long. I will update the review in 2015 when I have learnt all about it. The shots I have taken are great and it can be used as a point and shoot camera in its program mode but that would take the achievement away from producing great shots.
customer_reviews.author: Cypruss

customer_reviews.title: All that I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: It was time to upgrade from my Nikon D80 and I was looking for better results in poor light and improved auto focus. I was delighted with the initial results and there is more to achieve as I learn more of the camera's capabilities. The D7100 has a great feel and represents excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D S Dale

customer_reviews.title: super camera
customer_reviews.text: have upgraded from the D40 to this, it is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from beginner DSLR. Great overall camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this body as an upgrade from my previous D3300 and I'm loving this up to now. The body has a nice weight which is good imo. The button layout took getting used to but it's better. The quality is very slightly better, and low light performance is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade from D90
customer_reviews.text: After several years using a D90 I now find the D7100 an excellent upgrade. I use them both depending on lighting conditions where the D7100 allows more options using the D90's original AF-S Nikkor 18-105 lens and an AF-S Nikkor 70-300 lens. Couldn't be more satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Donald Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Superb camera which is very user friendly. Easy set-up and instant shooting without too much reading. The delivery was excellent however I was disappointed by the packaging as it never mentioned fragile/breakable and was only in the camera box within another amazon box. Luckily it arrived in one piece!! So I better stop moaning and get back to my camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Broomshanks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this camera is ideal for me and has taken some superb sport pictures,as attached
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: It's a good price, and I can't see myself replacing this ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a bottom of the range DSLR, but neither could I afford a top of the top of the range DSLR. It's a good price, and I can't see myself replacing this camera as it does everything I need and more.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera! I upgraded from an 8 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera! I upgraded from an 8 year old canon. It was a big decision to move from canon to nikon but I couldn't find a camera comparable from canon. I'm loving this camera, it is exceptional in low light too.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzypiglet

customer_reviews.title: I've bought other supposedly better camera but have always headed back to using this
customer_reviews.text: This camera has lasted me years. I've bought other supposedly better camera but have always headed back to using this.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Abel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent this has the wow factor i shot with Pentax cameras k5 k5iis for years and This is pretty darn incredible camera so pentax lost Nikon won and that says a lot comming from me who would never look at a Nikon all i can say is what a camera, its a must buy :))))))))))))))))))))))))
customer_reviews.author: Mr.

customer_reviews.title: Lovely camera
customer_reviews.text: Having owned a Nikon d300 and found it a bit heavy with a noisy shutter, the d7100 comes as, for me, almost perfect. I use it for wildlife photography so its extra crop factor, almost silent shutter and lighter weight make it an ideal companion. Image quality is superb...what more could you want!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Slade

customer_reviews.title: Good resolution and exposure latitude
customer_reviews.text: Moving on from my D200 I noticed a vast improvement in the highlights and shadows capability of the camera. Going up to 24 Megapixels also allows considerable cropping of images making them more useful. Half an image still produces a good A4 print. I am very pleased with the camera and the delivery was speedy from Amazon. Furthermore, the price was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Dr A

customer_reviews.title: Best entry level camrea
customer_reviews.text: Best entry level camrea! once you mange to fully operate this canmera, you are redy to jum to a full frame!
customer_reviews.author: Ian V.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my son who has this camera! Delighted with it. Quality product at great price! Immaculate condition!
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Nikon have really got this one right
customer_reviews.text: Previously I have favored Canon equipment, my son in law who is a professional photographer convinced me this was the best semi-professional camera on the market. He wasn't wrong the results have been amazing. The low light performance is outstanding and the 24 MP RAW images just blow me away.
customer_reviews.author: Britonbizz

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came without a battery charger very disappointed ting given the price
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a well loved D50. Camera and lens is far superior with all the necessary buttons within easy reach, which is much easier than going through the menu. An extremely powerful piece of kit
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brown

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Good camera with with fantastic images. Battery life seems to be a bit short compares with the descriptions given in the blurb. Needs practice to get used to some of the features though.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this for my son doing a level in photography, This is an ideal camera, does everything he wants to do, highly recommend , for good quality, and a lot cheaper to buy from here .
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Best camera on the market within it's spec and price range.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 camera bodies which have the 3 main lenses that I use for most applications. 1 D7000 & 2 D7100 all 3 will do more than I usually demand and the D7100 just does it better as you would expect. Just a really great specification camera with which I have become comfortable using and it's what I have come to expect from Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: trev skids

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I took it in a recent trip to the south of France where I shot simply beautiful pictures in both day light and also in very low light conditions. Paired with a 35mm lens it's perfect for portraits. Even at ISO 1600 you can't notice the digital noise unless you're really picky about it.
customer_reviews.author: Dragos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have been happy with this since day one. Can't ask for more from a consumer camera really.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best Buy I have made. Best camera I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: ABP103

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: A great camera for the price. Takes amazing photos and when paired with other lenses its outstanding. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Only just got it so still working my way around ...
customer_reviews.text: Only just got it so still working my way around it. Big upgrade from the D90. But controls very similar hence buying this model.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great semi pro camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Nikon D50. The d7100 camera is a greate camera for anyone that wants to taking photos into a more serious hobby. Very solid construction. I think I need to get some better lens to make use of the finer detail the camera is capable of producing.
customer_reviews.author: Nil

customer_reviews.title: Sweetheart
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use everyday. I have traveled, visited cold countries. This camera don't like cold windy weather, it starts working a little bit slower. But I still done a lot of great shots, so don't worry - buy it and enjoy your life with yourown Nikon! :)
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: nikon d7100
customer_reviews.text: what a great intuitive camera highly recommended for anybody who wants to upgrade and get results a pro would be proud of
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: D7100
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all what I expected previous camera D5100 That is also very camera needed to upgrade and the D 7100 suited all my needs
customer_reviews.author: cobber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: supurb Nikon manufacture and for the price fantastic and has most things covered
customer_reviews.author: mactay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not quite a D300 but I have bonded with it completely.
customer_reviews.author: Craybut

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and service
customer_reviews.text: My order arrived quickly and without fuss and the camera is fantastic. Although the zoom range on the included lens is not huge, the 24mp means you can crop and adjust pics without losing clarity. Great stuff for my first DSLR and so glad I made the decision to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As good as the best for that range. Would not change for any other.
customer_reviews.author: Awhillson

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the D300 and I still won't knock it but the D7100 just beats it in the low light stakes even though it has twice as many pixels crammed onto the same size sensor.
customer_reviews.author: petem56

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera at a great price . Seller is very good and would definitely use again .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: has so many pro features more than some full frame DSLR's, its amazing for the price. Image quality is also really good and i would definitely go for nikon if you are looking at canon too. Nikon give you so much more for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Gianluca Misso

customer_reviews.title: I was very happy when it arrived it's very good and very pleased ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy when it arrived it's very good and very pleased I've now bought a new lens for it and then over the moon now I have two new cameras now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Invest the time
customer_reviews.text: Requires a bit of investment time in order to learn how to get the best out of it, but well worth it. A great camera.
customer_reviews.author: F. Carrie

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast.
customer_reviews.text: Best camera I have now owned. Good with some situations at very high ISOs and sharp as a tack at low ones.
customer_reviews.author: Alex McGinlay

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Price/Quality the best there is on the market @ 2013 for photography and video With High end camera features with a nice range price for the Intermediate user.
customer_reviews.author: Mascanho

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: It has amazing picture quality. And if you are a beginner the auto mode allows you to still get a hang of the camera while still getting awesome pictures
customer_reviews.author: Kudakwashe

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Day 2 and its fantastic, but easy to be impressed as my last camera was a much loved, but old D40X. Brilliant results.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Stranks

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7100 Digital SLR Camera with 18-105mm VR Lens Kit (24.1MP)
customer_reviews.text: It arrived promptly as stated. It is a gift for my husband and I expect he will rate it highly when he receives it on Christmas Day
customer_reviews.author: Babs Gibson-Ward

customer_reviews.title: Nikon is best
customer_reviews.text: As expected for Nikon works well and feels good. Could not recommend it highly enough unless I could afford the D3 or better
customer_reviews.author: CJStorey

customer_reviews.title: cool camera
customer_reviews.text: nikon 7100, its really a cool camera, i love it, and the £100 reward, for Christmas if u buy from nikon, its amazing...
customer_reviews.author: noah io

customer_reviews.title: I just Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Well I have it now for 2 days, and man what a wealth of functions it has "mind blowing". I came from a Nikon D3100 and what a change it was. The images are so sharp. I was gonna go for a Nikon D600 but from what I read and seen on Youtube just put me clean off, Even to this date that problem still exists. "Way too much dough for that kinda chance" It will take me months to get the swing of all the features but for now its a winner in my eyes, I will update in a few months..
customer_reviews.author: OmaLanRF

customer_reviews.title: Go buy one!
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D7100 is a super camera; I'm only an amateur photography and this more than meets my needs, high spec but still very easy use. I'm ready pleased with it and the results I'm getting. It's that good I have used it to support my partner who is a professional wedding and portrait photography. (photographybymichellekemp.com). The only drawback is to work on the raw files you need Elements 11 or better, but that's a miner issue. If you are an amateur photography with a Nikon looking to upgrade then this is just what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: gally

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been interested in photography since 1983 and started with a Cosina SLR with a 50mm so since then I have had a camera or 2. My first digital SLR cost £2200 and was a Fuji Finpix S1. Then Nikon D70 etc. I recently have gone from D40, D3000, D3100, D3200, D90, to D7000. And then D7100 which is by far he best camera I have ever used. The images are superb and the handling is brilliant. If you thinking about buying one do not hesitate you will not be disappointed. And you can use almost any Nikon lens ever made even manual focus ones in M or A modes with metering and focus confirmation, brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D 7100
customer_reviews.text: Arrived well packed ( although in the camera and 18-105mm lens kit box ) All parts , cables etc there and working . Great camera and a good upgrade from my D5000 and D5100 . A word of warning to those who wanted to use the £100 cash back though . Although advertised as part of the deal Nikon do not accept it unless it is sold direct from Amazon , fulfilled by Amazon is excluded in the terms and conditions on the offer .
customer_reviews.author: Sean G

customer_reviews.title: From Bridge to DSLR !
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously a serious bit of kit, and I am a muppet (didnt know it until I started to use it!) There is so much to learn, play with, develop and just take it, it is frightening. The pictures I have managed to take, made my boy of 11 cry with amazement, and I haven't even started. It is so awesome I have had to join a local course to learn a bit more, cant wait for better weather, and more practice. If you are considering this, just get it, if you are saving up, keep doing it, don't get off early it is absolutely worth it !
customer_reviews.author: William Nomatez

customer_reviews.title: The Best DSLR on the market
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from my Nikon D90 and the image quality has to be seen to be believed. If you're in the market for a good quality DSLR but don't require full frame then this is the one to get. Worth every penny and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Traffic

customer_reviews.title: First 'real' DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after a LOT of research. I knew my budget and this was the best camera I could find in that budget, by far. Having now used it for a few months I can honestly say I am completely delighted. My photography has gone to another level and the camera as just what I'd hoped. Image quality, image control, camera ease of use are simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Superb piece of kit.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully made and engineered piece of kit,I haven't used it much yet as the weather has been so awful,but am spending a lot of time referring to the user manual,which I have downloaded as the one supplied is ridiculously small print,and familiarising myself with it.My previous camera was a D60 that served me well, so I'm looking forward to seeing what the D7100 can do,and according to the write-ups I won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Davo

customer_reviews.title: Without doubt Nikon's best DX camera yet
customer_reviews.text: I waited....and waited....and waited...for Nikon to produce a D400 to replace the aging D300s. I wanted a DX format body to complement my two FX bodies but, eventually, I got tires waiting for a pro-quality DX and chose to buy the "prosumer" D7100 instead. I expected to be disappointed. I was not. The D7100 is everything I moght have hoped the non-existent D400 might have been - and then a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoEcosse

customer_reviews.title: one excellent piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Having used my D3100 for the last year I wanted to trade up and , after a lot of deliberation and research, I decided on the D7100. There are lots of reviews online with regard to the huge features of this camera so there is no point in me repeating them. Suffice to say that the results that I have achieve using this body are amazing and I am delighted with my choice. Overall a wonderful camera.
customer_reviews.author: bobertc6

customer_reviews.title: Should you 'upgrade' from a D7000 - YES!
customer_reviews.text: Already own a D7000 (GREAT camera) and do a lot of macro with the 105mm Nikkor. This camera definitely takes better photos, no question about it! Noise issues at low ISO ? - rubbish. Its sharper, more responsive, improved ergonomics, excellent rear screen (no protection though), brilliant AF, more AF points - its simply better! I have taken over 1400 images so far and I love it, hence the 5 stars. My D7000 is now my everything else camera (its still a fantastic camera and a bargain nowadays) and my old everything else camera (a D5100) has somehow been adopted by my partner.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Colegate

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went for this
customer_reviews.text: Superb bit of kit. Saved up for ages. Glad I went for this, although, to be honest it has lots of functions that I will probably never use, and it will take me a long while to work my way through the instruction manual ( not the clearest ). Superb image quality for my needs, even with the kit lens ( couldn't afford another, that will be my next purchase). However it does work well with my other nikon lenses.
customer_reviews.author: carrut

customer_reviews.title: Simply fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I only had a bit of malfunction once but it was because i used it in wrong weather condition but after that it just do a fantastic job, it work fine it is very easy to use and the best is the quality of photos that i can do with this piece of kit, i simply love it and I recommended
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: DX Flagship
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this excellent camera, the built quality is superb and the features and functions are brilliant, a very versatile camera to add to the arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: John R Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Having been an Olympus fan for years I got frustrated with the lack of lens support for the 4/3 format. So after much debate decided to upgrade to a Nikon. Love the camera, pin sharp focus and packed with features, very impressed with the images so far.
customer_reviews.author: maddog

customer_reviews.title: Just what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with purchase it is a fantastic product. I was looking to upgrade my previous Nikon and this one is perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: E. G. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7100 Digital SLR Camera
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about this camera other than fantastic, i dithered between this and the D800 (Full frame) but on my reckoning for me the D7100 beat the D800 for what i needed. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lorri Driver

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Favourite camera from Nikon so far.. Excellent at low light photography. Only gripe, when using the 'scene' setting the dial and therefore setting can easily be inadvertently changed.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7100
customer_reviews.text: Nikon D7100 as always Nikon get their equipment exactly right and Photographers naturally get BETTER photographs. Never mind the other makes, always get the best!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Noble

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great buy at the price offered. Great on my d7100 on either landscape or portrait position. All controls are good for changing the cameras setting when required, came with non english manual and plug but saving over £200 this wasn't an issue and I haven't looked back, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: t fletcher

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant camera, havent used it to its fullest yet but such a lovely camera plus it does video as well.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Grimshaw

customer_reviews.title: Amazing-zing =D
customer_reviews.text: Lovely camera for both enthusiasts and pros.. Definitely love this camera and the lens it comes with. The possibilities are endless with this camera. A+
customer_reviews.author: Sean Spiteri

customer_reviews.title: Manual
customer_reviews.text: The package was great but it contained 2 manuals. The large one was in German and is therefore useless. The one in English is so small that it is impossible to read all the writing, especially that relating to diagrams. It would have been better to have the large, easiy readable manual in English!
customer_reviews.author: Martin perry

customer_reviews.title: Really Happy With This D7100
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is brilliant. Build quality is okay. Get a battery grip to go with it to give you more comfort.
customer_reviews.author: C. Erroch

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY BRILL
customer_reviews.text: THIS DX BODY IS A GEM AND WHEN COUPLED WITH A DX LENS IT SHINES, ONE OF NIKONS BEST CAMERAS
customer_reviews.author: D. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: excellent upgrade
customer_reviews.text: read al the reviews and decided that since I already has some DX lenses, this was the best choice to upgrade from a D300. I am not disappointed. Great value from Amazon as usual.
customer_reviews.author: John humphries

customer_reviews.title: Glad I decided to buy this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera performs far better than expected. Would recommend it to any serious camera enthusiast. Automatic focus is swift and outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: John Arnold

customer_reviews.title: perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: 5 star camera, very user friendly, easy to use, not sure how to use VR setting, perfect overall, i recommend it
customer_reviews.author: V. Iliev

customer_reviews.title: best camera in my budget and with almost all the ...
customer_reviews.text: best camera in my budget and with almost all the features to play around. good delivery service and above all, got the extended warranty and cashback
customer_reviews.author: NF

customer_reviews.title: Purchase of the Nikon D7100 Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D 7100 is an absolutely brilliant camera and it fulfils all my expectations. Will have many years of joy from it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Sensor Exposed
customer_reviews.text: The delivery came almost a week early, which was great, the product itself is great too. My only complaint is that the camera body came with no body cap, which meant the sensor was exposed to the environment from its journey from London to Aberdeen. I would expect when buying a body even if it was 2nd hand that the body coming with the body cap would be a minimum requirement. Lets hope there has been no damage to the sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: The best camera I have ever owned, it does everything for the beginner or nothing for the dedicated manual photographer. Lovely to hold, well balanced with kit lens, superb. PS Amazon delivered it on the 1st day of release - not bad going!
customer_reviews.author: John Mallaby

customer_reviews.title: Semi Pro Nikon D-SLR
customer_reviews.text: I have just graduated from a Nikon D80 which has served me well for 7 years. The time had come when I felt I wanted to take my photography to a new level, so the Semi Pro Nikon D7100 ticked all the boxes. I have been using the new camera for about a month and find it a pleasure to use. The results are superb and most of the function buttons are intuitive which averts the need to continually refer to menues.
customer_reviews.author: Jayenes

customer_reviews.title: Stunning
customer_reviews.text: There you have it, a one word review (apart from these) Just simply brilliant, words cannot describe just how good this camera is.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Superb Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Nikon cameras for over 30 years, and have never been let down by one. I also use a D300s and a D7000 and the D7100 seems to blend the best properties of both D300s and D7000, with a greatly improved sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Watson

customer_reviews.title: sharp as a tack
customer_reviews.text: this camera has changed the way i take images. its sharpness, dynamic range and pixel count are a joy to behold. hopefully i can take images to do it justice.
customer_reviews.author: brian mcdonnell

customer_reviews.title: D7100 with 18-105mm lens used at 2 weddings both inside no flash allowed excellent picture quality including 10 short mov files
customer_reviews.text: I up graded from Nikon d3200 needed two cards raw an one for jpeg or backup .D7100 with 18-105mm lens used at 2 weddings both inside no flash allowed excellent picture quality including 10 short mov files.using wifi cards down loaded to ipad so people could see pictures as they where taken.rate 5 love it.
customer_reviews.author: steven13

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful camera
customer_reviews.text: A truly impressive camera, tons of features, endlessly customisable settings, superb image quality, I couldn't be more happy with the D7100!
customer_reviews.author: K G Brown

customer_reviews.title: I grab a bargain
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera at a bargain price, and full uk Nikon 2 year guarantee. I was planning to add the D7200 as my DX camera (already own a Coolpix900, D750 and Df) but Amazon were out of stock, saw this body as a Warehouse offer. Glad I stuck with this purchase and saved a bit of dosh, the D7100 does everything I need and more - great pictures , every bit as good as the D750 and uses the same sensor as the D4 and Df. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: Doversoul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best there is - Replaces D300s and its nicer to use
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7100
customer_reviews.text: I'm delighted with this extremely well made, market leading camera that delivers such superb image quality; amazingly it is a significant improvement on the Nikon D7000 (the D7000 is also an excellent product that I sourced from Amazon and have retained as a back-up). My only disappointment with the Nikon D7100 is that it doesn't have a protective clip-on display screen cover like the D90 and D7000. Nevertheless, I wish I could give it more stars than five!
customer_reviews.author: D. Sproson

customer_reviews.title: but so far looks like a good upgrade from the d7000 very happy with ...
customer_reviews.text: only had the camera a few hours ,but so far looks like a good upgrade from the d7000 very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: ANN CHIPPERFIELD

customer_reviews.title: Great camera dreadful service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera through Gates Deals on the Amazon platform. Although Gates clearly stated in a reply to an enquiry that the camera was eligible for the Nikon £100 cashback, Nikon rejected my claim. Since then I have struggled with Gates and Amazon to get the £100 to which I am entitled. I don't hold out much hope but I shall keep struggling on.
customer_reviews.author: Dobcrosseagle

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, except for the black specks on the sensor.
customer_reviews.text: After spending the best part of a grand on this camera, I was gutted to find grey dots and black specks on most of my photographs. I have requested a refund, still deciding if I should risk it with this model again, as I really had my heart set on it.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Boyle

customer_reviews.title: best DX camera ever
customer_reviews.text: best DX camera ever... the buffer is a bit small in RAW, but everythign else is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: GregThurtle

customer_reviews.title: all round great camera for enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: A massive upgrade from my D40, all round great camera for enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: M Mitchell

product_meta.title: Nikon D7100 Digital SLR Camera Body (24.1 MP, 3.2 inch LCD)
product_meta.description:
Give your photographic passions an adrenaline injection with the exceptionally powerful D7100.

Surprisingly light and compact for a feature-packed and durable body, it delivers superior DX performance to take your photography to the next level. By not employing an optical low pass filter (OLPF), the D7100 makes the most of its 24.1-megapixel DX-format CMOS sensor to sharply capture even the finest textures in crisp high resolution. Its 51-point autofocus (AF) system offers you rapid and ultra accurate image capture at professional level. Drop, water and dust resistant, with magnesium alloy top and rear covers, this high-spec DSLR shoots continuously at 6 fps, gives an extra telephoto effect with innovative 1.3x crop function and has ISO sensitivity of 100-6400, bringing superb results in poorly-lit environments or fast-moving action.

Shoot with viewfinder or Live View, apply special effects in real time for stills or Full HD movies, and send images wirelessly* to your smart device for sharing on social media - the D7100 puts exceptional control in your hands, wherever you go, whatever you do.

KEY FEATURES



 * 24.1-megapixel DX format CMOS sensor, with no OLPF for extreme image sharpness on even the finest details.
 * EXPEED 3 image processor for high speed operation, vibrant colour reproduction and enhanced noise reduction.
 * ISO sensitivity of 100-6400, extendable to 25600 for exceptional low light performance.
 * Professional level AF system utilising 51 focus points - 15 of which are cross-type, for rapid and precise autofocus.
 * 6 fps continuous shooting to ensure you always capture that fast action shot.
 * 1.3x crop function, expanding the possibilities of DX format with extra telephoto effect, faster speed (up to 7 fps) and extra wide AF coverage.
 * 2016-pixel RGB metering sensor with Scene Recognition for highly accurate metering for exact exposures - optimising auto exposure (AE), autofocus (AF) and auto white balance (AWB) for supreme accuracy.
 * Full HD D-Movie - 1080p up to 60i/50i and 30p/25p/24p, for smooth movie recording.
 * High performance viewfinder with approximately 100% frame coverage and 0.94x magnification.
 * High-intensity LCD monitor offers an 8cm/3.2 inch 1229k-dot wide-angle view.
 * Conveniently portable - powerful features packed into a compact body weighing just 690g.
 * Durable body with magnesium alloy covers - sealed for dust, weather and drop resistance.
 * Dual SD memory card slots allow overflow and backup recording or set to record RAW and JPEG individually.
 * Accessible usability functions - improved 'i' button and Spot White Balance for quick and precise white balance setting in Live View.
 * Active D-Lighting (ADL) retains details in highlights and shadows for well-balanced images.
 * High Dynamic Range (HDR) combines two shots within a single shutter release to create detailed images of high contrast scenes.
 * Effects Mode allows selected effects to be applied to both stills and movies in Live View.
 * Wireless connectivity* - compatible with WU-1a Mobile Adapter.
 * With acclaimed NIKKOR lenses you can take full advantage of the camera’s 24.1 megapixels and 1.3x crop mode to create exceptional images and enjoy the portability of DX lenses.
 * Remote operation - easily control key camera functions remotely with optional WR-R10 and new H1104 wireless transceivers and WR-T10 wireless transmitter.

* Compatible with iOS™ and Android™ smart devices. This feature requires use of a dedicated Wireless Mobile Utility application that can be downloaded for free from Google Play™ and the Apple App Store™. Android, Google, Google Play, YouTube, and other marks are trademarks of Google Inc.

BOX CONTAINS
D7100 Camera Body
EN-EL15 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery (with terminal cover)
MH-25 Battery Charger
BS-1 Accessory Shoe Cover
DK-5 Eyepiece Cap 
DK-23 Rubber Eyecup
BF-1B Body Cap
UC-E17 USB Cable
AN-DC1 Neck Strap
ViewNX 2 CD
User's Manual
feature_bullets: 24.1 MP DX format CMOS sensor, with no OLPF for high image sharpness on even the finest details
Professional level AF system utilising 51 focus points - 15 of which are cross-type
1.3x crop function, expanding the possibilities of DX format with extra telephoto effect, faster speed (up to 7 fps) and extra wide AF coverage
Dual SD memory card slots allow overflow and backup recording or set to record RAW and JPEG individually
Effects Mode allows selected effects to be applied to both stills and movies in live view
